info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 19 at 3:58AM CDT until September 19 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central Oklahoma, including the following counties, Cleveland, McClain and Oklahoma.
* WHEN...Until 700 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 357 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oklahoma City, Norman, Edmond, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Choctaw, The Village, Spencer, Nichols Hills, Jones, Nicoma Park, Goldsby, Valley Brook, Arcadia, Tinker Air Force Base, Stanley Draper Lake, western Lake Thunderbird and Forest Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING

area.areaDesc: Cleveland, OK; McClain, OK; Oklahoma, OK
